contexts.wine_description: Damilano Barbera d'Asti DOCG is an exquisite Italian red wine from the renowned Piedmont region. It offers a unique combination of bright fruit flavors, with notes of cherry and raspberry, balanced by a subtle earthiness and hints of spice. This complex yet approachable wine has great depth and structure that make it perfect for pairing with a variety of foods. Enjoy this special treat from Piedmont and experience the unique character of Damilano Barbera d'Asti DOCG!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: This winery is steeped in family history, with the Damilano family owning it for over 150 years. As a result, all the members of the family are incredibly passionate about their work and love making wine together - so much so that they often joke that their blood type is actually Barbera d'Asti DOCG!
contexts.wine_history:
The Damilano family has been producing wine in the Langhe region of Piedmont since 1890. The Barbera d'Asti DOCG is one of their flagship wines, and it has been produced since the early 1900s. It is made from 100% Barbera grapes grown in the hills of Asti province.

The wine has won numerous awards over the years, including a Gold Medal at the International Wine Challenge in London in 2009 and a Silver Medal at the Decanter World Wine Awards in 2011. In 2012, it was named one of Italy's top 10 wines by Gambero Rosso.

Notable vintage years include 2004, 2006 and 2008, which were all highly rated by critics. The 2014 vintage was also praised for its intense aromas and flavors of ripe red fruit, spices and herbs.
contexts.wine_pairing: The Damilano Barbera d'Asti DOCG from Piedmont is a full-bodied, fruity red wine that pairs well with a variety of dishes. The bold flavors of this wine make it an ideal match for richly flavored dishes such as roasted meats, game, and aged cheeses. It also goes well with tomato-based pasta dishes, stews, and grilled vegetables. Additionally, the sweetness in the wine makes it great to pair with chocolate desserts or fruit-based tarts.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is a true taste of Italy! The Damilano Barbera d'Asti DOCG from Piedmont is a deep ruby red with aromas of cherries, rose petals, and sweet spices. On the palate, you'll find intense flavors of ripe wild berries, tobacco, and leather. The tannins are well balanced and provide great structure to the wine. This full-bodied Italian beauty is an absolute delight that pairs well with hearty dishes like lasagna or grilled steak. It's no wonder why this popular Piedmontese gem has become a favorite among wine enthusiasts worldwide!

contexts.wine_description: Yalumba Samuel's Collection Syrah is a unique and captivating red wine with intense aromas of blackberry and spice. On the palate, this full-bodied wine offers flavors of dark fruits, pepper, and vanilla with a hint of smokiness that lingers on the finish. Its complexity makes it an exciting and unforgettable experience!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery, Yalumba, was founded in 1849 by Samuel Smith and is the oldest, family-owned winery in South Australia. It has a unique tradition of celebrating its anniversary each year with 'Yalumba Day', where visitors are taken on a guided tour of the vineyard and treated to an afternoon of special tastings and entertainment!
contexts.wine_history:
Yalumba Samuel's Collection Syrah from Barossa is a classic Australian red wine that has been produced since the early 1990s. It is made from grapes grown in the Barossa Valley, one of Australia's most renowned wine regions. The Syrah grapes are sourced from some of the oldest and most respected vineyards in the region, and are hand-picked to ensure only the best quality fruit is used.

The first vintage of Yalumba Samuel's Collection Syrah was released in 1994, and it quickly became a favorite among wine lovers. Since then, it has consistently earned high ratings from critics and won numerous awards. Notable vintages include 1998, 2002, 2004, 2006, 2008 and 2010. In 2011, Yalumba Samuel's Collection Syrah was named "Best Red Wine" at the International Wine Challenge in London.
contexts.wine_pairing: The Yalumba Samuel's Collection Syrah from Barossa is a full-bodied and robust red wine with intense dark fruit flavors and spicy notes. It pairs well with dishes that have bold flavors such as grilled meats, game, beef stews, and strong cheeses. Rich tomato sauces, mushrooms, and roasted vegetables also pair nicely with this wine.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is one of the most popular Syrahs from Barossa Valley, and it's no wonder why! It has a deep, vibrant red color with aromas of dark blackberries, plums and violets. On the palate, it's full-bodied with smooth tannins and a long finish that lingers on the tongue. It's a perfect accompaniment to any meal - whether you're out for dinner or enjoying a cozy night in. And best of all, this wine is incredibly affordable while still delivering an exceptional experience. No wonder Yalumba Samuel's Collection Syrah from Barossa Valley is so popular!

contexts.wine_description: Experience the unique character of Masseria Li Veli's 'Askos' Susumaniello Salento IGT from Puglia. This rustic red wine has a deep, ruby hue and an intense bouquet of spices and ripe fruits. On the palate, it is full-bodied and velvety with smooth tannins that balance out its bold flavors of blackberry, cherry, and hints of tobacco. A truly unique experience!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery that makes this wine, Masseria Li Veli, is unique in that it uses a centuries-old irrigation system called “askos” which pumps out thousands of liters of water each year. This allows the vines to thrive and produce some of the best grapes in Puglia!
contexts.wine_history:
Masseria Li Veli 'Askos' Susumaniello Salento IGT is a red wine from Puglia, Italy. It is made from the indigenous grape variety Susumaniello and has been produced since the early 2000s. The winery, Masseria Li Veli, was founded in 1997 by the husband-and-wife team of Antonio and Maria Teresa Macrì. They have dedicated themselves to reviving traditional Puglian wines and preserving local varieties such as Susumaniello. 

The Askos Susumaniello is a blend of grapes grown on the estate’s vineyards in Leverano, in the heart of Salento. The vines are planted on clay soils with good drainage and are trained using traditional methods such as alberello (head pruning) and spurred cordon. The grapes are hand-harvested in late September or early October and then fermented in stainless steel tanks for about 10 days before aging for 12 months in French oak barrels. 

Notable vintages include 2012, which won a Gold Medal at the International Wine Challenge; 2013, which won a Silver Medal at Decanter World Wine Awards; 2014, which won a Bronze Medal at Decanter World Wine Awards; 2015, which won a Silver Medal at Mundus Vini; and 2016, which won a Gold Medal at Berliner Wein Trophy.
contexts.wine_name: Masseria Li Veli 'Askos' Susumaniello Salento IGT
contexts.wine_pairing: Masseria Li Veli 'Askos' Susumaniello Salento IGT is a full-bodied red wine from Puglia, Italy. It has intense aromas of blackberry, cherry and plum with hints of spice. This wine pairs well with roasted meats, grilled vegetables, tomato-based pasta dishes, and aged cheeses. It also goes nicely with dark chocolate desserts or a plate of cured meats and olives.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Masseria Li Veli 'Askos' Susumaniello Salento IGT from Puglia is an incredibly popular wine for a few reasons: it's full-bodied and jam-packed with flavor, boasting notes of dark cherry, blackberry, currant, and sweet spices. The tannins are firm yet velvety, while the finish lingers with a hint of cocoa. Plus, this wine is highly versatile - pair it with a variety of dishes such as grilled meats or roasted vegetables for an unforgettable experience!

contexts.wine_description: Domaine Jaume Vinsobres Altitude 420 from Rhone is a unique, high-altitude expression of the classic Rhone blend. This wine offers a complex bouquet of floral and red fruit aromas, with hints of spice and herbs. The palate is full-bodied and structured, with a bright acidity that provides balance and freshness. Enjoy this special wine for its distinctive character, complexity, and elegance.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The owners of Domaine Jaume Vinsobres Altitude 420 from Rhone have a friendly rivalry with their neighboring winery. As the two vineyards are located at different altitudes, they named the higher elevation vineyard “Altitude 420” in a nod to the cannabis culture!
contexts.wine_history:
The Domaine Jaume Vinsobres Altitude 420 is a red wine from the Rhone Valley in France. It is made from a blend of Grenache, Syrah, and Mourvèdre grapes grown on vineyards at an altitude of 420 meters. The winery was founded in 1891 by Jean-Baptiste Jaume and has been passed down through five generations of the Jaume family.

The first vintage of the Domaine Jaume Vinsobres Altitude 420 was released in 1998. Since then, it has become one of the most popular wines from the region and has earned numerous awards including a gold medal at the Concours des Vins de France in 2004.

Notable vintages include 2000, 2005, 2009, and 2015. In 2009, the wine was awarded a gold medal at the Concours des Vins de France for its intense aromas and complex flavors. In 2015, it won a silver medal at the same competition for its ripe fruit flavors and smooth tannins.
contexts.wine_pairing: This wine has a bright, fruity flavor and is best enjoyed with dishes that have similar flavors. Try pairing it with grilled salmon, roasted vegetables, or a light pasta dish. For cheese pairings, try something creamy like Brie or Camembert. If you're looking for a dessert to go with this wine, try something light like poached pears or a lemon tart.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is a fan favorite because it is bursting with flavor! The Domaine Jaume Vinsobres Altitude 420 from Rhone has a unique blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre grapes that create a complex and full-bodied red. Its deep ruby color hints at the sweet notes of dark fruits and spices like blackberry, licorice, and pepper. Aged in oak barrels for 18 months to add complexity and depth, this wine is sure to tantalize your taste buds. With its bold yet balanced flavor profile, it's no wonder why the Domaine Jaume Vinsobres Altitude 420 from Rhone is one of the most popular wines around!

contexts.wine_description: Joseph Drouhin Pouilly-Fuisse is a unique and exciting white wine that will tantalize your taste buds. It has a bright, fresh flavor with notes of citrus and stone fruits, balanced by a creamy texture and subtle oak nuances. The well-rounded palate finishes with a lingering finish of minerality and nutty aromas. This special wine is sure to delight even the most discerning palates!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The Joseph Drouhin winery has a very unique relationship with the French language! The name of the winery is named after the family patriarch, Joseph Drouhin – who only spoke French and German. As such, the winery’s labels are printed in both languages, and the Maconnais vineyards produce wines with both French and German names.
contexts.wine_history:
Joseph Drouhin Pouilly-Fuisse is a white Burgundy wine from the Maconnais region of France. It is made from Chardonnay grapes and has been produced since the late 19th century. The first vintage was in 1885, and it quickly became popular among French winemakers. In the early 20th century, Joseph Drouhin purchased some of the best vineyards in the region and began producing his own version of Pouilly-Fuisse. Since then, Joseph Drouhin has become one of the most respected producers of this wine. 

Notable vintages include: 
-1947: This vintage was considered to be one of the best ever for Pouilly-Fuisse, with intense aromas and flavors that were described as "exquisite". 
-1959: This vintage was also highly praised for its complexity and balance. 
-1985: This vintage marked the 100th anniversary of Joseph Drouhin's production of Pouilly-Fuisse, and it was celebrated with a special edition bottle. 
-2005: This vintage was considered to be one of the best in recent years, with ripe fruit flavors and excellent acidity.
contexts.wine_pairing: Joseph Drouhin Pouilly-Fuisse is a light and crisp white wine with notes of citrus, stone fruit, and a hint of minerality. It pairs well with lighter seafood dishes such as steamed mussels or poached salmon. It also goes great with creamy cheese like Brie or Camembert. The acidity in the wine helps to cut through the richness of these dishes. Other foods that pair nicely include roasted chicken, vegetable risotto, and grilled vegetables.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Joseph Drouhin Pouilly-Fuisse from Maconnais is a remarkable white wine that has become the toast of connoisseurs everywhere. It has a crisp, refreshing taste with aromas of citrus, melon and honey. Its minerality and subtle oak notes give it an elegant complexity that is sure to please any palate. This exquisite French Chardonnay is sure to be the star of your next dinner party! So pour yourself a glass and enjoy this popular wine's unique flavor - you won't regret it!

contexts.wine_description: Quinta do Vesuvio Single Quinta Vintage Port is a luxurious and unique fortified wine that offers an intense, complex flavor profile. It has a deep ruby color and aromas of ripe black fruits, dark chocolate, and hints of spice. On the palate you will find layers of dark fruit flavors, with notes of coffee, cocoa and toasted oak. The finish is long and lingering. This rare vintage port is sure to delight even the most discerning palates.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery at Quinta do Vesuvio has a unique tradition of using goatskins to hold their wine! The tradition dates back centuries and is still practiced today, with the goatskins being used to store vintage port.
contexts.wine_history:
Quinta do Vesuvio Single Quinta Vintage Port is a port wine produced by the Symington family in the Douro Valley of Portugal. The Symingtons have been producing port since 1882 and are one of the oldest and most respected producers in the region. 

The Quinta do Vesuvio Single Quinta Vintage Port was first released in 1994, making it one of the first single quinta vintage ports ever produced. This wine is made from grapes grown on the estate's own vineyards, which are located on steep terraces overlooking the Douro River. 

Notable vintages include 1997, 2000, 2003, 2007, 2011 and 2016. The 1997 vintage was particularly noteworthy for its intense aromas and flavors of dark fruit and spices. The 2000 vintage was praised for its complexity and balance while the 2003 vintage was lauded for its ripe fruit flavors and long finish. The 2007 vintage was highly acclaimed for its rich texture and depth of flavor while the 2011 vintage was praised for its elegance and finesse. Finally, the 2016 vintage is considered to be one of the best vintages ever produced by Quinta do Vesuvio with intense aromas of blackberry jam, dark chocolate, licorice and spice.
contexts.wine_name: Quinta do Vesuvio Single Quinta Vintage Port
contexts.wine_pairing: Quinta do Vesuvio Single Quinta Vintage Port pairs well with a variety of rich and sweet dishes. It is especially nice with dark chocolate desserts, blue cheeses, walnuts, dried fruits such as figs, dates or apricots, and cured meats such as prosciutto or salami. It is also great with roasted red meats like beef or lamb. For a lighter option, it can be paired with grilled vegetables or creamy pasta dishes.
contexts.wine_popularity: This is no ordinary wine! Quinta do Vesuvio Single Quinta Vintage Port is a rich, complex and luxurious vintage port that is sure to tantalize your taste buds. Its intense flavors of black cherry and dark chocolate mingle with notes of dried fruit and spice, while its velvety tannins provide a lingering finish. This wine has won numerous awards, including two gold medals at the International Wine Challenge and the Decanter World Wine Awards. It's no wonder why this exquisite port has become so popular among connoisseurs around the world!

contexts.wine_description: Chateau La Gaffeliere is a unique and special Bordeaux blend with a deep ruby color. This wine boasts aromas of dark fruit, minerals, and licorice that are complemented by flavors of blackberry, cherry, tobacco, and cedar. On the palate it is full-bodied yet elegant with well-integrated tannins and a long finish. Enjoy this exquisite wine for its distinctive character and complexity.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Chateau La Gaffeliere is known for its unusual practice of harvesting the grapes with a hot air balloon!
contexts.wine_history:
Chateau La Gaffeliere is a Grand Cru Classe estate located in the Saint-Emilion appellation of Bordeaux, France. It was first established in the 18th century by the Gaffeliere family, who owned it until the early 20th century. In 1921, it was purchased by the Lurton family, who still own and manage it today. 

The estate is known for producing wines that are full-bodied and complex with aromas of dark fruits, spices and earthy notes. The vineyard covers 24 hectares (59 acres) of clay-limestone soils planted with Merlot (60%), Cabernet Franc (30%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (10%). 

Notable vintage years include 2009, 2010 and 2015 which were all rated as outstanding by critics. In 2012, Chateau La Gaffeliere was awarded the Grand Cru Classe status from the Saint-Emilion Classification system. This classification is updated every 10 years and recognizes only the best estates in Saint-Emilion.
contexts.wine_pairing: Chateau La Gaffeliere is a full-bodied, complex red wine from Saint-Emilion in Bordeaux, France. It has intense aromas of dark fruit and spices, with a long finish. This wine pairs well with rich dishes such as grilled steak, lamb or game meats, roast duck or pork, and hard cheeses. It also goes well with mushroom-based dishes like risotto or pasta. For dessert pairings, try dark chocolate or berry tarts.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is a true star of the Bordeaux region! It's full-bodied and powerful, with a deep ruby color and intense aromas of dark fruit, cedar, and tobacco. The tannins are well-integrated and smooth, while the finish lingers with a hint of spice. Chateau La Gaffeliere from Saint-Emilion is an absolute delight for any wine lover – it's no wonder why it remains one of the most popular wines from Bordeaux!

contexts.wine_description: Etude Cabernet Sauvignon from Napa Valley is a unique and exciting wine. It has a deep, dark color with intense aromas of blackberry, currant, and cassis. On the palate, it has lush flavors of black cherry and dark chocolate with hints of oak and vanilla. The finish is long and silky with a pleasant acidity that lingers on the tongue. This bold yet balanced Cabernet Sauvignon is perfect for those looking for an unforgettable experience in a glass.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery hosts a “Crush Party” every year where visitors can stomp grapes with their bare feet and take part in the traditional grape crushing process.
contexts.wine_history:
Etude Cabernet Sauvignon from Napa Valley was first produced in 1982 by winemaker Tony Soter. The winery is located in the Carneros region of Napa Valley, and the grapes are sourced from vineyards throughout the valley. Etude wines have consistently been rated highly by critics, with some vintages receiving scores of 95 or higher. 

Notable vintage years include 1995, 1997, 2001, 2004, 2007 and 2009. In 1995, Etude released its first Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon which received a score of 95 points from Robert Parker. In 1997, Etude released its first single-vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon which also received a score of 95 points from Robert Parker. In 2001, Etude released its first Pinot Noir which received a score of 94 points from Wine Spectator magazine. 

In 2004, Etude celebrated its 20th anniversary with the release of their 20th Anniversary Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon which received a score of 96 points from Robert Parker. In 2007 and 2009 respectively, Etude released their 25th Anniversary Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon and 30th Anniversary Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon both receiving scores of 97 points from Robert Parker.
contexts.wine_pairing: Etude Cabernet Sauvignon has a deep, full-bodied flavor and is best paired with rich, flavorful dishes. It pairs well with beef, lamb, game meats, and hard cheeses like Parmesan or aged cheddar. It also goes great with roasted vegetables such as mushrooms, eggplants, and peppers. For a heartier meal try pairing it with hearty stews or braised dishes like beef bourguignon or beef short ribs.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Etude Cabernet Sauvignon from Napa Valley is a must-have for any wine enthusiast! Rich, dark fruit flavors of blackberry and cassis are balanced by subtle hints of oak and spice. Its supple tannins provide a smooth finish that lingers on the palate. With a perfect balance between acidity and body, this full-bodied red wine has been a favorite among wine lovers for years. A sip of this delicious Cabernet Sauvignon will take you on an unforgettable taste journey!

contexts.wine_description: Luke Merlot from Wahluke Slope is a unique and exciting wine that offers a bold, yet balanced flavor profile. This Merlot has intense aromas of dark berries and spices, which lead to a rich palate of blackberry jam, cocoa powder, and earthy notes. Its signature terroir from the Wahluke Slope provides an unmistakable complexity and structure that will leave you wanting more. Enjoy this special Merlot with friends or family for an unforgettable experience.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The owners of the winery, Luke and Merlot, are actually a married couple who named the winery after themselves! They enjoy telling visitors that they are literally drinking “love” when they taste their wine.
contexts.wine_history: The Luke Merlot from Wahluke Slope was first released in 2002, and has since become a popular choice among Washington wine lovers. The grapes for this Merlot come from the Wahluke Slope AVA, an area known for its warm days and cool nights, which allow the grapes to ripen slowly and evenly. This creates a balanced flavor profile that is both rich and complex. Notable vintage years include 2005, 2007, 2009, 2011, 2013, 2015 and 2017. In 2018, the winery was awarded a Gold Medal at the San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition for their 2017 vintage of Luke Merlot. This wine has become a favorite among many Washington wine enthusiasts due to its unique flavor profile and consistent quality over the years.
contexts.wine_pairing: Luke Merlot is a full-bodied and robust red wine, with notes of dark cherry, blackberry, and plum. It pairs well with hearty dishes such as beef stew, grilled steak, lamb chops, and roasted duck. It also goes great with sharp cheeses like blue cheese or aged cheddar. For a lighter option, it can be paired with mushroom risotto or roasted vegetables.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Luke Merlot from Wahluke Slope has the perfect blend of flavors and aromas that make it one of the most popular wines in town! Its bold and robust taste is highlighted by its dark cherry and blackberry notes, while its subtle oak finish adds a layer of complexity. With its velvety texture, this wine is sure to delight any connoisseur or casual drinker alike. So don't wait - grab a bottle of Luke Merlot today and experience why it's a fan favorite!

contexts.wine_description: Bodegas Avancia Godello is an exciting and unique white wine that is full of character. It has a bright, zesty aroma with notes of melon, citrus, and stone fruit that give way to a refreshingly crisp finish. This wine stands out for its complexity and depth of flavor, making it an excellent choice for any occasion.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery is located in the historic village of Oseja de Sajambre, which was founded by a group of pilgrims on their way to Santiago de Compostela in the 9th century. As a fun fact, legend has it that these pilgrims were so impressed with the natural beauty and climate of the area, they decided to make it their new home!
contexts.wine_history:
Bodegas Avancia Godello is a white wine from the Valdeorras region of Spain. It was first produced in the late 19th century, and has since become one of the most popular wines in the region. The winery is located in the small village of Oseira, which is known for its unique terroir and ideal climate for growing Godello grapes. 

The winery has been producing this wine since the early 1900s, but it wasn't until the 1980s that it began to gain recognition as a quality wine. In 1988, Bodegas Avancia released their first vintage of Godello, which quickly became a favorite among locals and tourists alike. Since then, they have continued to produce award-winning vintages each year. Some notable vintages include: 2004 (which won a gold medal at the International Wine Challenge), 2008 (which won a silver medal at Decanter World Wine Awards), and 2011 (which won a gold medal at Mundus Vini).
contexts.wine_pairing: Bodegas Avancia Godello from Valdeorras is a white wine that has a light and refreshing body with notes of citrus, peach, and melon. It pairs well with seafood dishes like grilled shrimp or scallops, as well as lighter poultry dishes like roasted chicken. It also goes nicely with salads, pasta dishes with light sauces, and even some mild cheeses.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is a unique and tantalizing experience that has everyone talking! The Bodegas Avancia Godello is a full-bodied white wine with an intense and complex flavor. Its balance of sweet and acidic notes creates an unforgettable taste that lingers on the palate. The aroma is filled with tropical fruits, citrus, and hints of honey. Plus, this wine pairs perfectly with seafood dishes, making it a favorite among foodies. With its high quality and affordable price tag, it's no wonder why Bodegas Avancia Godello from Valdeorras is so popular!

contexts.wine_description: Domaine du Vieux Telegraphe Chateauneuf-du-Pape La Crau is a unique and exciting wine. It has an intense, bold flavor with notes of dark cherry, blackberry, and spice. Its complexity comes from the combination of soil types found in the vineyards of the region - limestone, clay, and sandstone - giving it a distinctive character that sets it apart from other wines in its class. Enjoy this robust and flavorful red for a truly memorable experience.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: This winery is known for its unusual rum-drinking pigs! Each year, the winery invites visitors to observe these pigs being fed sugarcane and then watch them enjoy a shot of rum from their specially designed trough. It's said that the rum helps to mellow out the flavors of the pork they are raised on.
contexts.wine_history:
The Domaine du Vieux Telegraphe Chateauneuf-du-Pape La Crau is a red wine from the Rhone region of France. It was first produced in the late 19th century by the Brunier family, who had been making wines in the area since 1891. The vineyard is located on a plateau at an altitude of 350 meters and consists of clay and limestone soils. The vines are grown using traditional methods, with yields kept low to ensure quality.

Notable vintage years include 2005, 2007, 2009, 2010, 2012 and 2015. In 2005, the wine was awarded a score of 95 points by Robert Parker's Wine Advocate and was named one of the top 10 wines of the year. In 2007, it was awarded 97 points by Wine Spectator magazine and named one of their top 100 wines for that year. In 2009, it was awarded 96 points by Wine Enthusiast magazine and named one of their top 100 wines for that year. 

In 2010, Domaine du Vieux Telegraphe Chateauneuf-du-Pape La Crau received its first perfect score from Robert Parker's Wine Advocate with a rating of 100 points. This made it one of only two wines from Chateauneuf-du-Pape to receive such an accolade at that time. Since then, it has consistently been rated highly by critics and remains one of the most sought after wines from this region.
contexts.wine_name: Domaine du Vieux Telegraphe Chateauneuf-du-Pape La Crau
contexts.wine_pairing: This full-bodied and robust red wine from the Rhone region pairs best with strong flavors such as grilled steak, lamb, and game meats. It also goes well with hard cheeses like blue cheese, aged cheddar, and Parmesan. Other accompaniments include roasted vegetables, mushrooms, olives, and cured meats. It is also a great match for rich dishes such as cassoulet or braised short ribs.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Domaine du Vieux Telegraphe Chateauneuf-du-Pape La Crau from the Rhone Valley is a wine that has been praised by wine critics and connoisseurs alike. It's a blend of Grenache, Syrah, Mourvedre and Cinsault grapes that have been grown in an ideal microclimate and harvested at optimal ripeness. The result is a full-bodied red wine with intense aromas of ripe raspberry, cherry, and blackberry fruit, intertwined with earthy notes of spice and leather. On the palate, there's a complex interplay of flavors that range from juicy red fruits to savory spices and herbs. The finish is incredibly long and velvety smooth, making this a truly memorable experience for any wine lover. With its perfect balance of fruit and savory complexity, it's no wonder why Domaine du Vieux Telegraphe Chateauneuf-du-Pape La Crau is one of the most sought after wines in the world!

contexts.wine_description: Charles Woodson's 'Intercept' Chardonnay from Paso Robles is a unique and exciting wine that combines the best of both worlds. It has the classic elegance of a Chardonnay with the complexity and depth of Paso Robles terroir. The nose is full of tropical fruit, citrus, and floral notes, while the palate offers a rich texture and creamy finish. Enjoy this special wine as an accompaniment to your favorite meals or simply sip it for its own pleasure.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery that makes Charles Woodson's 'Intercept' Chardonnay from Paso Robles has a unique policy of only hiring retired NFL players to work in the vineyard! Although they don't make the wine, they bring their years of football experience to ensure their grapes are harvested with precision and care!
contexts.wine_history: Charles Woodson's 'Intercept' Chardonnay from Paso Robles was created in 2016, when the former NFL star and Heisman Trophy winner partnered with winemaker Justin Smith of Saxum Vineyards to craft a special wine. The wine is made from grapes sourced from the Adelaida District of Paso Robles, an area known for its limestone-rich soils and cool climate. The 2016 vintage was highly acclaimed, earning 93 points from Wine Enthusiast magazine. Since then, Charles Woodson's 'Intercept' Chardonnay has become a popular choice among wine enthusiasts, with each vintage receiving high praise.
contexts.wine_pairing: Charles Woodson's 'Intercept' Chardonnay from Paso Robles is a full-bodied and rich white wine with aromas of citrus, tropical fruits, and honeysuckle. It pairs well with many dishes, including roasted chicken or pork, creamy pasta dishes, seafood like salmon and shrimp, and mild cheeses like brie or camembert. It also goes nicely with lighter fare such as salads and grilled vegetables.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Chardonnay from Paso Robles is nothing short of legendary! It's made by Charles Woodson, former NFL star and Heisman trophy winner, who puts his legendary touch on every bottle. The wine is bursting with aromas of fresh citrus fruits, honeycomb and a hint of oak. On the palate, you'll get flavors of ripe apples, toasted nuts and a creamy texture that lingers on the finish. It's no wonder why this wine has become so popular - it's an absolute pleasure to drink!

contexts.wine_description: This is a unique and exciting Nebbiolo from the renowned Piedmont region. Pecchenino Botti Langhe Nebbiolo has a complex flavor profile with aromas of rose petals, cherries, and violets, complemented by notes of spices and tobacco. Its tannins are well-balanced, giving it an elegant structure that will linger on the palate. Enjoy this special wine to experience the true essence of Piedmont's terroir.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery Pecchenino is one of the few that still use ancient, traditional methods to press their grapes. Every year, they organize a 'grape stomping' competition, where visitors try to produce the most juice and have a lot of fun!
contexts.wine_history:
The Pecchenino family has been making wine in the Langhe region of Piedmont since the late 19th century. The Botti Langhe Nebbiolo is a blend of Nebbiolo grapes from several vineyards, including some that have been in the family for generations. The first vintage was produced in 2004 and it quickly became one of the most sought-after wines from Piedmont. 

Notable vintages include 2006, 2008, 2010, 2012 and 2014. In 2017, the winery was awarded a prestigious Tre Bicchieri award from Gambero Rosso for its 2014 vintage. This recognition further cemented Pecchenino's reputation as one of the top producers in Piedmont.
contexts.wine_pairing: The Pecchenino Botti Langhe Nebbiolo pairs well with a variety of dishes. This full-bodied red wine is perfect for pairing with rich, savory dishes such as braised short ribs or osso buco. It also goes well with roasted vegetables, grilled steak, and mushroom risotto. For a lighter pairing, try it with fresh salads or fish dishes like salmon or tuna. Its tannins and acidity make it an excellent accompaniment to charcuterie and aged cheeses.
contexts.wine_popularity: This full-bodied, ruby-hued wine from the Piedmont region of Italy is a fan favorite for its bold and complex flavor. Its aromas of ripe cherries, plums and violets are followed by a palate of dark berries, spices and leather. The finish lingers with notes of tobacco and licorice, making it an ideal pairing with grilled meats, game or aged cheeses. With its long history of excellence, this Nebbiolo from Pecchenino Botti Langhe is sure to be a hit at your next dinner party!

contexts.wine_description: Bodegas Terras Gauda O Rosal from Rias Baixas is an exciting white wine that stands out with its unique flavor profile. Bursting with notes of citrus, stone fruit and hints of herbs, this crisp and refreshing wine has a vibrant acidity that complements its delicate minerality. Enjoy this unique Spanish white on its own or paired with your favorite seafood dishes for an unforgettable experience!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The head winemaker of Bodegas Terras Gauda O Rosal, Jose Martin Moreda, has a passion for creating unique wines and is known to be quite the prankster! He often plays practical jokes on his staff as they work in the vineyards, making sure everyone stays cheerful and entertained.
contexts.wine_history:
Bodegas Terras Gauda O Rosal is a winery located in the Rias Baixas region of Galicia, Spain. It was founded in 1986 by two brothers, Jose and Xosé Lois Sebio, who had a passion for creating unique wines from the native Albariño grape variety. The winery has since become one of the most renowned producers of Albariño in the world. 

The winery's flagship wine is Bodegas Terras Gauda O Rosal, which is made from 100% Albariño grapes grown on their estate vineyards. This wine has been produced since 1989 and has earned numerous awards over the years, including a Gold Medal at the International Wine Challenge in 2007 and a Double Gold Medal at the San Francisco International Wine Competition in 2008. 

Notable vintage years include 2005, 2006, 2009 and 2010, all of which were highly acclaimed by critics and consumers alike. The 2010 vintage was particularly noteworthy as it was awarded 94 points by Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate and named one of the “Top 100 Wines of 2011” by Wine Spectator magazine.
contexts.wine_pairing: Bodegas Terras Gauda O Rosal is a fresh and fruity white wine with notes of citrus, pear, and apple. It pairs well with a variety of dishes, including seafood, chicken, and vegetable dishes. Try it with seared scallops over a bed of sautéed spinach or grilled salmon with lemon and capers. It also pairs nicely with roasted vegetables like Brussels sprouts or asparagus. For cheese pairings, try it with creamy Brie or goat cheese.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is a fan favorite for its bright and refreshing flavor. Made with the Albariño grape, it has a delicate balance of fresh citrus fruit, herbal notes, and a hint of salinity. Its crisp acidity pairs beautifully with seafood dishes, making it an ideal accompaniment to any summertime meal. But it's not just the taste that makes this wine so popular - its stunning label featuring hand-painted illustrations of the winery's lush vineyards and surrounding landscape makes it an eye-catching addition to any table. So pour yourself a glass of Bodegas Terras Gauda O Rosal and experience why this Rias Baixas white is beloved by all!

contexts.wine_description: El Molino Chardonnay from Rutherford is a unique and exciting wine that bursts with flavor. This full-bodied white has an exquisite balance of ripe fruit, toasty oak, and creamy buttery notes that linger on the palate. Distinctive aromas of tropical fruits, citrus, and floral notes provide an inviting bouquet that pairs beautifully with seafood dishes. Enjoy this Rutherford classic for its smooth texture and complex yet harmonious flavor profile.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: El Molino Winery is run by a family of Italian immigrants who make all their wines according to traditional Italian winemaking methods. They also believe in the power of superstition and are known to frequently hang garlic around the winery to ward off bad luck!
contexts.wine_history:
El Molino Chardonnay from Rutherford is a classic California Chardonnay that has been produced since the early 1980s. The winery was founded by the late Bill and Mary Ann Smith, who purchased an old stone mill in Rutherford, California in 1979. They planted their first vineyard in 1981 and released their first vintage of El Molino Chardonnay in 1983. 

Since then, El Molino Chardonnay has become a staple of the Napa Valley wine scene. It is known for its bright fruit flavors and balanced acidity, which make it a great food-pairing wine. Notable vintages include the 1985, which won a Gold Medal at the San Francisco International Wine Competition; the 1988, which won a Double Gold Medal at the same competition; and the 1990, which was named one of Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 1992. 

In recent years, El Molino Chardonnay has continued to be highly regarded for its quality and consistency. In 2018, it was awarded 93 points from Wine Enthusiast Magazine and 90 points from Robert Parker's Wine Advocate.
contexts.wine_pairing: El Molino Chardonnay is a full-bodied, creamy white wine with notes of apple and pear. It pairs well with creamy pastas, grilled seafood, roasted chicken, pork dishes, and mild cheeses. For appetizers, try a cheese plate featuring some soft Brie and Camembert as well as some semi-hard cheeses like Cheddar or Gruyere. If you're looking for something more substantial to pair with this white wine, consider lighter meats such as pork chops or grilled shrimp. Vegetables like mushrooms and roasted cauliflower also make great accompaniments to this Chardonnay.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Chardonnay from Rutherford is no ordinary wine! It's a masterpiece of flavor and texture, with notes of ripe citrus and tropical fruit that dance across your palate. Its creamy texture and subtle oak character make it the perfect accompaniment to any dinner or special occasion. Plus, its unique terroir from Rutherford gives it an unmistakable complexity and depth that you won't find in other wines. So if you're looking for a memorable experience, El Molino Chardonnay from Rutherford is the way to go!

contexts.wine_description: This unique Mazzei Zisola Noto Rosso from Sicily is a captivating wine with bold flavors and aromas. The combination of Nero d'Avola, Frappato, and Perricone grapes creates a complex flavor profile with notes of blackberry, cherry, and licorice. Its bright acidity and smooth tannins make this wine a perfect pairing for grilled meats or tomato-based dishes. Enjoy the unique character of this Sicilian red!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: At Mazzei Zisola Noto Rosso, the winery owners offer a unique 'wine pairing experience.' Visitors are invited to tour the vineyard and cellar, where they learn how to pair wines with local dishes. Every dish is accompanied by a different glass of wine, chosen specifically to highlight the flavors of each dish. Not only is it a great way to learn more about Italian cuisine, but it also makes for an unforgettable tasting experience!
contexts.wine_history:
The Mazzei Zisola Noto Rosso is a blend of Nero d'Avola and Frappato grapes from the Noto region of Sicily. The Mazzei family has been producing wines in this area since the 15th century, and their winemaking tradition is still going strong today. 

The first vintage of the Mazzei Zisola Noto Rosso was released in 2002, and it has quickly become one of the most popular wines from Sicily. It is known for its intense aromas of ripe red fruits, spices, and herbs, as well as its smooth tannins and balanced acidity. 

In recent years, the wine has gained even more recognition due to its inclusion in several prestigious international competitions such as Decanter World Wine Awards and International Wine Challenge. In 2020, it was awarded a Gold Medal at the Decanter World Wine Awards for its outstanding quality.
contexts.wine_pairing: Mazzei Zisola Noto Rosso is a full-bodied and complex red wine with notes of blackberry, prune, cherry, leather, tobacco, and licorice. It pairs well with grilled meats like steak or lamb chops, tomato-based sauces such as Bolognese or arrabbiata, mushrooms, and hard cheeses like Parmigiano Reggiano. It also goes well with Italian dishes like pizza and pasta dishes with robust flavors such as carbonara or puttanesca.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Mazzei Zisola Noto Rosso from Sicily is a wine that will tantalise your taste buds! With its full-bodied, fruity flavour and intense aroma of sun-ripened cherries and spicy notes, it's no wonder why this wine has become so popular. Its soft tannins, balanced acidity and smooth finish make it the perfect choice for any occasion. Enjoy this delicious red with grilled meats, pasta dishes or simply on its own - you won't be disappointed!

contexts.wine_description: This unique rose from the south of France is a complex and exciting blend of Grenache, Tibouren, and Cinsault grapes. Clos Cibonne Cotes de Provence Cuvee Tradition Rose has a vibrant salmon hue with notes of ripe strawberry and white peach on the nose. On the palate, it is light-bodied with bright acidity and hints of citrus and herbs. Enjoy this exquisite rose to enhance any summer gathering!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Clos Cibonne is unique because it has the oldest vineyard in Provence – dating back to 1683! The winery also has its own bee hives, and the bees produce their own honey which they use in recipes like their famous rosemary-infused honey ice cream.
contexts.wine_history:
Clos Cibonne Cotes de Provence Cuvee Tradition Rose is a classic Provencal rosé made from Tibouren, an ancient grape variety native to the region. The winery was founded in 1858 by Jean-Baptiste Cibonne and has been family-owned ever since. The estate is located in the heart of the Var department in Provence and is surrounded by vineyards, olive groves, and pine forests.

The Clos Cibonne winery produces several different wines, including their signature Cuvée Tradition Rosé. This wine is made from Tibouren grapes grown on the estate’s terraced vineyards. It has a pale pink color with aromas of citrus fruits and white flowers. On the palate, it offers flavors of peach, apricot, and melon with a crisp finish.

Notable vintage years for Clos Cibonne Cuvée Tradition Rosé include 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019. In 2017, the wine was awarded a Gold Medal at the Concours des Vins de Provence. In 2018, it was named one of Wine Enthusiast Magazine’s Top 100 Wines of the Year.
contexts.wine_name: Clos Cibonne Cotes de Provence Cuvee Tradition Rose
contexts.wine_pairing: Clos Cibonne Cotes de Provence Cuvee Tradition Rose is a light, crisp, and dry rosé with notes of strawberry and citrus. This wine pairs well with light seafood dishes such as grilled salmon or seared scallops, as well as salads and lighter pasta dishes. It also goes well with goat cheese, charcuterie, olives, and roasted vegetables.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is like a ray of sunshine in a glass! It's light, crisp and refreshing with intense aromas of white peach and fresh red berries. Its well-balanced acidity and subtle floral notes make it the perfect companion for any summer day. The Clos Cibonne Cotes de Provence Cuvee Tradition Rose is an award-winning rose that has been celebrated by wine lovers around the world for its elegant style and delicious flavor. Enjoy this classic French rose on its own or paired with your favorite seafood dishes for a truly memorable experience!

contexts.wine_description: Fontanafredda Serralunga d'Alba is a unique and exciting wine that offers an intense and complex bouquet of aromas. It has a deep ruby color and its rich, full-bodied flavor profile features notes of ripe cherries, dried herbs, licorice, leather, tobacco, and truffles. The tannins are firm yet smooth and the finish is long and persistent. This highly sought-after Italian red wine is an excellent choice for special occasions or to enjoy with a meal.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Fontanafredda Serralunga d'Alba has its own vineyard donkey, affectionately named 'Bruno.' Bruno is used to help with the harvesting of grapes and vines, as well as delivering wine barrels from the winery. He also has his own custom-made saddlebags for carrying his snacks around the vineyards!
contexts.wine_history:
Fontanafredda is one of the oldest wineries in the Serralunga d'Alba region of Barolo DOCG, having been established in 1878 by King Vittorio Emanuele II. The estate has been owned and managed by the same family for five generations, and its vineyards are planted with some of the most prestigious Nebbiolo clones. 

The estate produces a range of wines from Barolo DOCG, including Fontanafredda Serralunga d'Alba. This wine is made from 100% Nebbiolo grapes grown in the Serralunga d'Alba sub-zone of Barolo DOCG. It is aged for at least three years in large oak barrels before being released onto the market. 

Notable vintage years include 2010, 2012, 2014 and 2016, which have all been highly acclaimed by critics. The 2014 vintage was particularly impressive, with Wine Spectator awarding it 95 points and describing it as "richly layered and complex".
contexts.wine_pairing: Fontanafredda Serralunga d'Alba from Barolo DOCG is a full-bodied, dry red wine. It has dark fruit flavors, earthy notes and a hint of spice. This wine pairs well with dishes that have bold flavors such as grilled meats, game and aged cheeses. It also goes well with mushroom-based dishes like risotto or pasta dishes with a meat sauce. Rich desserts such as chocolate truffles and panna cotta also pair nicely with this wine.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is a classic of the Barolo DOCG, and it's no wonder why it's so popular. The deep garnet color hints at the complexity of the flavors to come. On the nose, you'll find aromas of black cherry, fresh herbs, tobacco, and sweet spice. On the palate, there are layers of ripe dark fruit flavors, earthy notes, and a hint of oak. The tannins are round and velvety while the finish is long and lingering. This exquisite wine is truly an Italian masterpiece that will have you coming back for more!

contexts.wine_description: Dakota Shy Cabernet Sauvignon is a deep, bold and complex red wine that offers a unique experience. The intense flavors of dark cherry, blackberry, and plum are complemented by subtle notes of spice, tobacco, and oak. This full-bodied wine has a long finish with hints of mocha and vanilla. Enjoy this one-of-a-kind Cabernet Sauvignon from the renowned Napa Valley!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery prides itself on the fact that it was founded by two childhood friends who decided to follow their dreams of becoming winemakers despite coming from a small town in the Midwest. The name “Dakota Shy” comes from the fact that they were so shy, they had to come up with a clever way to be seen and heard - hence, their exclusive Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon!
contexts.wine_history:
Dakota Shy Cabernet Sauvignon is a Napa Valley wine that was first produced in 2006. It was created by winemaker Paul Hobbs, who sourced grapes from the renowned Beckstoffer Vineyards in Rutherford. The inaugural vintage of Dakota Shy Cabernet Sauvignon was highly acclaimed and has since become a sought-after cult classic. 

Notable vintages include the 2007, which earned a score of 94 points from Robert Parker's Wine Advocate, and the 2008, which earned 95 points from the same publication. The 2009 vintage was also well-received, earning 93 points from Wine Spectator. 

In 2013, Dakota Shy Cabernet Sauvignon received its first 100 point rating from Robert Parker's Wine Advocate for its 2010 vintage. This milestone cemented its reputation as one of Napa Valley's most sought-after wines.
contexts.wine_pairing: Dakota Shy Cabernet Sauvignon is a full-bodied red wine with notes of blackberry, blueberry, and cassis. It pairs well with rich dishes such as steak, roast beef, lamb, and game meats. It also goes well with bold flavors like mushrooms, strong cheeses, and dark chocolate. Enjoy it with grilled vegetables or roasted root vegetables like potatoes or sweet potatoes to bring out the sweetness of the wine.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Cabernet Sauvignon from Napa Valley is a hit! The Dakota Shy Cabernet Sauvignon has a deep, ruby-red color and aromas of ripe blackberry, cherry and cassis. On the palate, it offers luscious flavors of blackberry jam and licorice that linger on the finish. Its full body and soft tannins make it an ideal companion to grilled steak or lamb. It's no wonder why this wine is so popular - its bold flavor and smooth texture make it truly irresistible!

contexts.wine_description: San Salvatore Falanghina Campania IGT is a unique white wine that offers an exciting flavor profile. contexts.wine_history:
San Salvatore Falanghina Campania IGT is a white wine produced in the Campania region of Italy. It is made from the Falanghina grape variety, which has been grown in this area since ancient Roman times. The San Salvatore winery was founded in the late 19th century and has been producing wines since then. 

The first vintage of San Salvatore Falanghina Campania IGT was released in 1997, and it quickly became popular with wine lovers for its fresh and fruity character. Over the years, the winery has experimented with different techniques to enhance the quality of their wines, such as aging them in oak barrels or stainless steel tanks. 

In recent years, San Salvatore Falanghina Campania IGT has become one of the most sought-after Italian white wines. Notable vintages include 2010, 2011 and 2012, which have all received high scores from critics and won numerous awards.
contexts.wine_pairing: San Salvatore Falanghina Campania IGT is a crisp and dry white wine with aromas of citrus, green apple, and floral notes. contexts.wine_popularity: The San Salvatore Falanghina Campania IGT is a wine that captures the essence of Southern Italy. Its bright, golden-yellow hue and intense aromas of ripe peach, apricot, and honeycomb make it a delight to sip on. contexts.wine_description: This unique Domaine Gerard Fiou Sancerre Terroir Silex from the Loire Valley is a vibrant and flavorful white wine that bursts with bright citrus flavors and a hint of minerality. Its distinct terroir of flinty silex gives it an unmistakable character that truly sets it apart from other wines in the region. Enjoy its complexity and expressive aromas for a truly memorable experience.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The Domaine Gerard Fiou winery is well known for its innovative approach to wine making, which includes aging wines in barrels made from old barrels recycled from a local Sancerre cheese factory.
contexts.wine_history:
This wine is produced by Domaine Gerard Fiou, a family-run winery located in the Loire Valley of France. The winery was established in the early 1950s and has been producing high-quality Sancerre wines since then. The Terroir Silex is made from 100% Sauvignon Blanc grapes grown on the rocky soils of the region. This terroir gives the wine its unique minerality and complexity. 

Notable vintage years for this wine include 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019. All of these vintages have received excellent reviews from critics and consumers alike. 

In recent years, Domaine Gerard Fiou has become increasingly popular among sommeliers and wine enthusiasts due to its high quality and unique flavor profile. In 2018, the winery was awarded a Gold Medal at the Concours Mondial de Bruxelles for its Terroir Silex Sancerre. This recognition further solidified Domaine Gerard Fiou's reputation as one of the top producers of Sancerre wines in the Loire Valley.
contexts.wine_name: Domaine Gerard Fiou Sancerre Terroir Silex
contexts.wine_pairing: The Domaine Gerard Fiou Sancerre Terroir Silex from Loire is a classic French white wine that pairs well with seafood, chicken, and soft cheeses. contexts.wine_popularity: This Domaine Gerard Fiou Sancerre Terroir Silex from Loire is a fan favorite for its unique blend of flavors and aromas.
