contexts.wine_description: Experience the unique terroir of Marlborough with Astrolabe 'Valleys' Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc. This crisp, vibrant white wine offers a complex flavor profile, with notes of ripe stone fruits, fresh herbs, and a hint of minerality from the Awatere Valley. Its bright acidity and balanced finish make it an ideal accompaniment to seafood dishes or as a refreshing summer sipper. Enjoy this unique expression of Marlborough's distinctive terroir!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Astrolabe Winery is the only winery in Marlborough to have its own beehive, which produces a special 'Valleys' honey that they use to make their Sauvignon Blanc!
contexts.wine_history:
Astrolabe 'Valleys' Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough was first released in 2003. The wine is made from grapes grown in the Awatere Valley, a sub-region of Marlborough located on the South Island of New Zealand. This region has a cool climate and is known for producing wines with intense aromas and flavors. 

The Astrolabe winery was founded by Simon Waghorn in 1999 and has since become one of the most respected wineries in Marlborough. The winery focuses on producing single-vineyard wines that express the unique terroir of each vineyard site. 

Notable vintage years for this wine include 2004, 2005, 2007, 2008, 2009, 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014. Each vintage has been highly acclaimed by critics and consumers alike for its intense aromas and flavors of citrus fruits and herbs.
contexts.wine_pairing: Astrolabe's Valleys Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc is a bright, crisp wine with notes of citrus and tropical fruits. It pairs well with seafood dishes such as grilled salmon or shrimp, as well as light salads and herbed goat cheese. It also goes nicely with poultry dishes like roasted chicken or turkey and creamy pasta dishes such as fettuccine alfredo. For more adventurous pairings, try it with spicy Asian cuisine like Thai curries or Vietnamese pho.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Astrolabe 'Valleys' Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough has become a fan favorite due to its bright and fresh aromas of passionfruit, guava, and grapefruit. On the palate, it is zesty with a hint of minerality that makes it refreshingly crisp. This wine has a lingering finish that will have you wanting more every sip!

contexts.wine_description: Domaine Huet Vouvray 'Le Haut Lieu' Sec is an exquisite, dry white wine that offers a unique flavor experience. Its complex aromas of honey and ripe stone fruit are balanced with zesty citrus notes, while its vibrant acidity and minerality provide a refreshing finish. This unique wine is made from Chenin Blanc grapes grown in the steep hillsides of the Loire Valley, which gives it a distinctive character that sets it apart from other wines.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery is run by two brothers, and since they both have the last name Huet, they often have to be called out by their middle names to avoid confusion.
contexts.wine_history:
The Domaine Huet Vouvray 'Le Haut Lieu' Sec is a dry white wine from the Loire Valley in France. It is made from Chenin Blanc grapes grown on the estate's vineyards, which have been owned by the Huet family since 1928. The first vintage of this wine was produced in 1952 and it has been produced every year since then. 

The terroir of the vineyards is unique, with a combination of clay and limestone soils that give the wine its distinctive character. The vines are planted on steep slopes facing south-east, allowing them to benefit from maximum sunlight exposure. 

The winemaking process at Domaine Huet is traditional and artisanal, with minimal intervention and no use of chemicals or additives. The wines are aged for several years before being released, giving them complexity and depth of flavor. 

Notable vintages include the 1985, 1988, 1989 and 1990 vintages which were all highly acclaimed by critics for their balance and finesse. In recent years, Domaine Huet has also won numerous awards for its wines including a gold medal at the Concours Mondial de Bruxelles in 2019 for its 2017 vintage.
contexts.wine_name: Domaine Huet Vouvray 'Le Haut Lieu' Sec
contexts.wine_pairing: The Domaine Huet Vouvray 'Le Haut Lieu' Sec is a dry white wine that pairs well with light dishes such as seafood, salads, and white meats. It also goes great with dishes featuring herbs and spices like Thai or Indian cuisine. The acidity of this wine makes it an ideal pairing for creamy cheeses like Brie, Camembert, and goat cheese. Its bright fruit flavors make it a great companion to fruit-based desserts like apple tarts or poached pears.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Domaine Huet Vouvray 'Le Haut Lieu' Sec from Loire is a wine that will tantalize your taste buds! It's a dry, light, and crisp white that has notes of lemon and lime. Its complex minerality and floral aromas add to its appeal. This popular wine has a fantastic balance between acidity and sweetness, making it perfect for any occasion. Enjoy the bright and refreshing flavors of this delightful white wine today!

contexts.wine_description: Mastroberardino Radici is a unique and exciting wine that will tantalize your taste buds. It's a bold, full-bodied red with intense aromas of blackberry, plum, and dark chocolate. Its complexity is highlighted by notes of tobacco, leather and earthiness which are complemented by a smooth finish with balanced tannins. This exquisite Italian wine has been aged for 12 months in oak barrels and bottle-aged for an additional 12 months to create its unique flavor profile. Enjoy Mastroberardino Radici from Taurasi DOCG to experience the finest Italian wines!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Mastroberardino Radici has the distinction of being one of the oldest wineries in Italy, with more than 200 years of history! The family's passion and dedication to the craft is a testament to their commitment to producing high-quality wines. What's even funnier is that the traditional label for their Taurasi DOCG bottles features a pig wearing a top hat!
contexts.wine_history:
Mastroberardino Radici from Taurasi DOCG is a red wine produced in the Campania region of Italy. It was first made by the Mastroberardino family in the late 19th century, and has since become one of the most iconic wines of the region. The wine is made from Aglianico grapes grown on steep hillsides in the province of Avellino.

The first vintage of Mastroberardino Radici was released in 1971, and it quickly became a favorite among Italian wine lovers. In 1995, it was awarded its own DOCG status, making it one of only two wines to receive this prestigious designation from Campania. Since then, Mastroberardino Radici has been recognized as one of Italy's finest wines, with several vintages receiving high scores from critics such as Robert Parker and Wine Spectator. Notable vintages include 2001, 2004, 2006, 2008 and 2010.
contexts.wine_pairing: Mastroberardino Radici is a full-bodied, robust red wine with notes of blackberry, cherry, and spice. It pairs well with grilled meats, hearty stews, roasted vegetables, and aged cheeses. It also goes well with traditional Italian dishes such as lasagna and pizza. The tannins in the wine make it an ideal accompaniment to tomato-based sauces and richly flavored dishes.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is truly a masterpiece of flavor and complexity! Mastroberardino Radici from Taurasi DOCG is renowned for its intense ruby red hue, balanced tannins, and aromas of blackberry, dark cherry, licorice and hints of cocoa. On the palate, it's smooth and velvety with bold flavors of ripe plum, blueberry jam and mocha. This full-bodied red wine is perfect for pairing with grilled meats or hard cheeses - the perfect way to make any dinner memorable! It's no wonder why this wine has become so popular - it's simply delicious.

contexts.wine_description: Raen Royal St. Robert Cuvee Pinot Noir is an exquisite, complex wine with a unique flavor profile that sets it apart from other Pinot Noirs. This full-bodied wine has aromas of wild raspberry and black cherry, with a hint of toasty oak and earthy spice. Its juicy berry flavors are balanced by firm tannins and a long finish. Enjoy this rare gem of a wine for its one-of-a-kind character!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery is run by a team of royal penguins! They fly into Sonoma Coast every year to oversee the production of the Royal St. Robert Cuvee Pinot Noir.
contexts.wine_history:
Raen Royal St. Robert Cuvee Pinot Noir from Sonoma Coast was first released in 2011, and is a blend of grapes sourced from the best vineyards in the region. The wine is made by winemaker Wells Guthrie, who has been crafting wines in Sonoma County since 1998. He sources grapes from some of the most sought-after vineyards in the area, including Dutton Ranch, Rochioli Vineyard, and Sangiacomo Vineyard. 

The 2011 vintage was particularly noteworthy for its intense aromas of ripe cherry and raspberry fruit, with hints of baking spices and earthy undertones. It also had a velvety texture on the palate with balanced acidity and a long finish. 

Since then, Raen Royal St. Robert Cuvee Pinot Noir has become one of the most sought-after wines from Sonoma Coast. The 2012 vintage was awarded 90 points by Wine Enthusiast Magazine and was named one of their Top 100 Cellar Selections for 2014. The 2013 vintage received 91 points from Wine Spectator Magazine and was included in their Top 100 Wines of 2015 list.
contexts.wine_name: Raen Royal St. Robert Cuvee Pinot Noir
contexts.wine_pairing: This Pinot Noir pairs well with a variety of dishes, from light and fresh salads to creamy pastas. It is especially good with salmon, roasted chicken, mushrooms, and other earthy flavors. It also goes great with soft cheeses like Brie and Camembert, as well as charcuterie platters featuring prosciutto or salami. For dessert, try it with dark chocolate truffles or fruit-based desserts such as poached pears.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Raen Royal St. Robert Cuvee Pinot Noir from the Sonoma Coast is a wine that's sure to tantalize your taste buds! It's an exquisite blend of bright cherry, raspberry and strawberry flavors with a hint of spice. The palate has a silky smooth texture with good structure and balance. Its complexity and elegance make it a favorite among connoisseurs. Enjoy this delightful wine with your favorite dishes - you won't be disappointed!

contexts.wine_description: Gaston Chiquet Premier Cru Brut Tradition is a remarkable champagne that offers an exciting and unique flavor experience. This premier cru champagne is crafted with traditional methods, allowing the terroir of the Champagne region to truly shine. It has an intense yet balanced aroma of citrus and white flowers, with a hint of brioche on the palate. Its fine bubbles provide an elegant finish that lingers on the tongue. Enjoy this exquisite bottle of Gaston Chiquet Premier Cru Brut Tradition to elevate any special occasion!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Gaston Chiquet is the only winery in Champagne that uses a unique, horse-drawn plough to till their vineyard. This allows them to tend their vineyard with minimal disruption to the soil, promoting better growth and healthier vines.
contexts.wine_history:
Gaston Chiquet is a family-owned Champagne house that has been producing wines since 1730. The Premier Cru Brut Tradition is a blend of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier grapes from the Grand Cru vineyards in the Vallée de la Marne. It is aged for at least three years on the lees before release. 

The vintage years of this wine have been consistently good, with some notable vintages being 2002, 2004, 2006 and 2008. In 2009, Gaston Chiquet was awarded the prestigious “Grande Marque” status by the Comité Interprofessionnel du Vin de Champagne (CIVC). This recognition is given to only a handful of Champagne houses each year and it signifies excellence in quality and consistency. 

In 2014, Gaston Chiquet launched its first organic cuvée, which was made entirely from organically grown grapes from their own vineyards. This marked an important milestone for the house as they continue to strive for sustainable practices in winemaking.
contexts.wine_name: Gaston Chiquet Premier Cru Brut Tradition
contexts.wine_pairing: Gaston Chiquet Premier Cru Brut Tradition is a classic champagne that pairs well with a variety of foods. Its light and crisp flavor profile makes it an excellent match for seafood dishes, such as sushi, oysters, or crab cakes. It also goes great with light cheeses like Brie or Camembert, and can even be enjoyed with fried foods like tempura. This champagne’s acidity also makes it a great accompaniment to fruit-based desserts, such as tarts or sorbet.
contexts.wine_popularity: This premier cru brut tradition from Champagne is a true classic. Its popularity stems from its impeccable balance of flavors, with an initial burst of citrus and a creamy finish. The complexity of this wine is impressive, with toasty aromas, light minerality and hints of green apple, pear and brioche. It's an ideal accompaniment for any special occasion - whether it be a romantic dinner or a celebratory toast!

contexts.wine_description: This Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir is a truly unique and exciting wine. It's sourced from Russian River Valley, renowned for its cool climate and excellent soil composition that produces some of the world's best Pinot Noirs. This particular wine has a complex flavor profile with notes of ripe cherry, raspberry, and dried herbs. Its well-balanced acidity and soft tannins make it an ideal accompaniment to any meal. Enjoy this one-of-a-kind Pinot Noir for its distinctive character and depth of flavor!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard has a mascot, Fido the Fox! Fido loves to run around the vineyards and greet visitors. He also likes to dress up in costumes for special occasions, such as sporting a tuxedo for wine tastings and donning lederhosen for festivals.
contexts.wine_history:
Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir is a single-vineyard wine from the Russian River Valley in Sonoma County, California. The vineyard was planted in 1997 by winemaker and proprietor Bill Price, who named it after his father's favorite saying: "Lucky Well." The vineyard is located on a south-facing slope of the Russian River Valley, and produces small yields of intensely flavored grapes. 

The first vintage of Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir was released in 2001. Since then, the wine has become highly sought after for its intense aromas and flavors of dark cherry, blackberry, and spice. It has also been praised for its balanced acidity and velvety tannins. Notable vintages include 2004, 2007, 2009, 2011, 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2016. 

In 2018 Arista Winery was awarded the prestigious Wine Enthusiast Magazine's "American Winery of the Year" award for their commitment to producing high quality wines from sustainably farmed vineyards. This recognition further solidified Arista's place as one of California's premier producers of Pinot Noir.
contexts.wine_name: Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir
contexts.wine_pairing: Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir from Russian River Valley is a light-bodied red wine with bright acidity, ripe fruit flavors and notes of earthy spice. It pairs well with roasted poultry dishes, such as chicken or turkey, as well as grilled salmon or tuna. It also goes great with mushroom risotto, roasted vegetables, and mild cheeses such as brie or camembert. The light body of the wine makes it a great accompaniment to lighter fare such as salads, charcuterie boards and antipasto platters.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir from Russian River Valley is a fan favorite, and it's easy to see why! Its lush, ruby-red color hints at the complexity of its flavors – think black cherry, raspberry, and earthy notes. The smooth tannins and balanced acidity create an unforgettable mouthfeel that lingers on the palate. With a perfect balance between fruitiness and earthiness, this wine is sure to make any occasion special. So raise a glass of Arista UV Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir and celebrate life's little moments!

contexts.wine_description: Vine Hill Ranch 'VHR' Cabernet Sauvignon is a luxurious, full-bodied red wine with intense aromas of ripe blackberry, cassis and mocha. This unique Cabernet Sauvignon has a long, velvety finish that lingers on the palate. It's an unforgettable experience for any wine lover!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Vine Hill Ranch's Cabernet Sauvignon is made with grapes sourced from some of the oldest vines in Napa Valley. The joke on the ranch is that these vines are so old, they have to be pruned using a ladder!
contexts.wine_history:
Vine Hill Ranch (VHR) Cabernet Sauvignon is a single-vineyard wine from the renowned Napa Valley. The vineyard was originally planted in 1868 by William and Mary Bourn, who were some of the first settlers in the region. The vineyard has been farmed continuously since then, and is now owned by the family of Bill Harlan, founder of Harlan Estate. 

The VHR Cabernet Sauvignon has become one of the most sought-after wines in Napa Valley, with its first vintage released in 1999. Since then, it has consistently earned high scores from critics and won numerous awards. Notable vintages include 2001, 2003, 2005, 2007, 2009 and 2010. In 2012, Wine Spectator named VHR Cabernet Sauvignon as one of their Top 100 Wines of the Year.
contexts.wine_pairing: Vine Hill Ranch 'VHR' Cabernet Sauvignon is a bold and powerful wine, so it pairs well with robust and flavorful dishes. Rich cuts of beef like ribeye or filet mignon are great options, as well as heartier game dishes like venison and duck. For vegetarians, try pairing the Cabernet Sauvignon with a wild mushroom risotto or roasted root vegetables. To bring out the fruitiness of the wine, serve it alongside dishes featuring dark fruits like blackberries or plums, such as a blackberry compote or plum tart.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Vine Hill Ranch 'VHR' Cabernet Sauvignon from Napa Valley is the perfect blend of boldness and finesse. It has a robust nose of black currant, clove and cedar that lead to a velvety palate of dark berry flavors, hints of espresso and soft tannins. Its complexity and structure make it a wine that can be enjoyed now or cellared for years to come. With its deep color, intense flavor, and well-balanced finish, it's no wonder why this wine is so popular!

contexts.wine_description: Experience the unique flavor of Companion Wine Co. Oliver's Vineyard 'Sunny B'! This vibrant, sun-kissed wine offers a refreshing blend of citrus and tropical fruit flavors with a smooth finish. Perfect for any occasion, this one-of-a-kind wine is sure to delight your senses.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Companion Wine Co. Oliver's Vineyard is definitely a unique place because it was the first winery in California to be powered entirely by solar energy! Along with their commitment to sustainability, they have a playful mascot, Sunny B, who will entertain you while you sip their delicious wines!
contexts.wine_history:
Companion Wine Co. Oliver's Vineyard 'Sunny B' from Edna Valley was first released in 2017. It is a blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir grapes grown in the cool climate of Edna Valley, California. The vineyard was planted in the early 1990s by winemaker and owner, Oliver McCrum, who has been crafting wines from this site since then. 

The 2017 vintage of Sunny B was particularly noteworthy for its bright acidity and intense aromatics. The 2018 vintage saw a slightly warmer growing season, resulting in a more full-bodied wine with ripe fruit flavors and a creamy texture. 

In 2019, Companion Wine Co. celebrated its 10th anniversary with the release of their limited edition “Sunny B” label featuring artwork by local artist, Sarah Gee Miller. This special label commemorates the unique terroir of Edna Valley and celebrates the long history of winemaking at Oliver’s Vineyard.
contexts.wine_name: Companion Wine Co. Oliver's Vineyard 'Sunny B'
contexts.wine_pairing: This wine has bright, tropical fruit flavors and a light body. It pairs well with foods that are light and fresh, such as salads, grilled vegetables, fish, and lighter meats like chicken and pork. The acidity of this wine makes it a great match for dishes that have citrus or other acidic ingredients, such as lemon or tomatoes. It also goes nicely with creamy cheeses like brie or goat cheese.
contexts.wine_popularity: The sun-kissed hills of Edna Valley are home to the renowned Oliver's Vineyard, and its grapes produce some of the most sought-after wines in the region. One of these is 'Sunny B', a delightful white wine from Companion Wine Co. This full-bodied beauty offers bright aromas of melon, vanilla, and lemon peel that tantalize the senses. On the palate it is lush with flavors of honeydew, citrus blossom, and a hint of spice. The finish is smooth and refreshing, with a lingering essence that will have you coming back for more! No wonder 'Sunny B' from Oliver's Vineyard has become so popular - it's simply irresistible!

contexts.wine_description: Vina Almaviva EPU is a unique Chilean blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère, Merlot, and Petit Verdot. This full-bodied red has aromas of ripe blackberries and cherries with hints of tobacco, dark chocolate and spices. On the palate, it offers bold flavors of cassis and plum that are complemented by soft tannins and a long finish. Enjoy this complex and elegant wine for its rich character and deep complexity.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The vineyards at Vina Almaviva EPU are situated on the slopes of the Andes mountain range, and the winery is renowned for its quirky experimentations. In one particular experiment, they attempted to create a new variety of grape by combining an old pre-phylloxera strain with a modern varietal. The end result was a unique creation named 'Almavino' which neither had the full flavour of its predecessors nor could be classified as an existing varietal!
contexts.wine_history:
Vina Almaviva EPU from Puente Alto is a Chilean wine that was first produced in 1997. It is a joint venture between Baron Philippe de Rothschild and Concha y Toro, two of the most renowned winemakers in the world. The vineyard is located in the Maipo Valley, one of Chile's most prestigious wine regions. 

The first vintage of Vina Almaviva EPU was released in 1998 and has since become one of Chile's most sought-after wines. It has consistently earned high scores from critics and has been awarded numerous awards over the years, including being named Wine Spectator's "Wine of the Year" in 2000. 

In addition to its success as a wine, Vina Almaviva EPU has also become known for its sustainability efforts. In 2008, it became the first winery in South America to be certified by the Rainforest Alliance for its commitment to sustainable practices.
contexts.wine_pairing: Vina Almaviva EPU is a full-bodied red wine with intense aromas of ripe fruit, spices, and oak. It pairs particularly well with grilled meats, such as steak or lamb, as well as hearty stews and rich cheeses. The bold flavors of the wine also pair nicely with dishes that contain tomatoes, mushrooms, and olives. Additionally, this wine can be enjoyed with desserts such as chocolate cake or tiramisu.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Chilean wine is a powerhouse of flavor, boasting an intense bouquet of rich blackberry, plum, and earthy notes. On the palate, it's velvety smooth with hints of spice and oak that gradually unfold into a long, lingering finish. It's a complex wine that appeals to both novice and experienced wine drinkers alike. The quality of Vina Almaviva EPU from Puente Alto is undeniable - it's no wonder why it's become one of the most popular wines in Chile!

contexts.wine_description: Calera Jensen Vineyard Pinot Noir is an exquisite, earthy and complex wine that will tantalize your taste buds. This unique Pinot Noir is grown on the high elevation slopes of Mount Harlan in California's Central Coast region, where the cool climate produces a balanced and elegant style. Its intense aromas of dark cherry, raspberry and dried herbs are complemented by a velvety texture with subtle tannins and a long finish.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The Calera Jensen Vineyard was started by a pair of brothers, Josh and Jesse Jensen. They bought their first tractor in order to plow the vineyard and named it "Harley," after Mount Harlan where the vineyard is located. It was the only tractor they ever needed; they still use it today!
contexts.wine_history:
The Calera Jensen Vineyard Pinot Noir from Mount Harlan was first planted in 1975 by Josh Jensen, a former geologist who had a passion for wine. He chose the site for its unique combination of soils and climate, which he believed would be ideal for growing Pinot Noir. The vineyard has since become one of California's most renowned sites for producing high-quality Pinot Noir. 

Notable vintage years include 1994, 1997, 1999, 2001, 2002, 2004 and 2006. These vintages have been praised for their complexity and balance. In addition to these great vintages, the vineyard has also produced some exceptional wines in more recent years such as the 2011 and 2012 vintages. 

In 2013, Calera celebrated its 40th anniversary with a special release of its flagship Pinot Noir from the Jensen Vineyard. This wine was made from grapes grown on vines that were planted in 1975 and is considered to be one of the best expressions of this varietal from this region.
contexts.wine_pairing: This Calera Jensen Vineyard Pinot Noir has a bright cherry and cranberry nose, with notes of vanilla, baking spices, and earthy mushrooms. It pairs well with a variety of dishes, including roasted poultry or pork, grilled salmon, mushroom risotto, and creamy pasta dishes. It also goes well with charcuterie boards featuring cured meats, cheeses, olives, nuts, and pickles. Enjoy it alongside a plate of fresh oysters on the half shell for an indulgent experience.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Calera Jensen Vineyard Pinot Noir from Mount Harlan is a special treat for wine aficionados! The perfect blend of bright cherry and raspberry flavors, with nuances of earthy spice, creates an incredibly well balanced and complex wine. This fine Pinot Noir has been praised by critics and consumers alike for its smooth tannins and long finish. With every sip you will be taken on a journey through the unique terroir of Mount Harlan that gives this wine its distinct character. So uncork a bottle today to experience why this Pinot Noir is so popular!

contexts.wine_description: This crisp, refreshing white wine from Tzora Vineyards is a unique expression of the Judean Hills region in Israel. Its complexity and depth of flavor make it an exciting choice for wine lovers looking to explore something new. With notes of citrus and green apple, it has a bright acidity and mineral finish that will tantalize your taste buds. Enjoy this singularly special Blanc from Judean Hills for its distinctive character and unmistakable quality.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Tzora Vineyards is the only winery in Judean Hills that produces both wine and cider from their vineyards. They also offer tours of their vineyard where guests can sample various wines, ciders, and even grape juice! The view from the vineyards is said to be particularly beautiful, with a panoramic view of Jerusalem.
contexts.wine_history:
Tzora Vineyards is a family-owned winery located in the Judean Hills of Israel. Founded in 1998 by brothers Shuki and Yair Yechiel, Tzora has become one of the most respected wineries in the region. The vineyard is situated on a hilltop with an elevation of 600 meters, providing ideal conditions for growing grapes. 

The Blanc from Judean Hills is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay, and Viognier grapes. This wine has been produced since 2001 and has won numerous awards over the years. In particular, it was awarded a gold medal at the International Wine Challenge in London in 2008 and 2009. It also received a silver medal at the Decanter World Wine Awards in 2010. 

The vintage years for this wine have been consistently good since its inception, with some particularly noteworthy vintages being 2004, 2007, 2011, and 2015. Each vintage offers unique characteristics that make it stand out from the rest. 

Overall, Tzora Vineyards' Judean Hills Blanc is an excellent example of Israeli winemaking that continues to impress critics around the world.
contexts.wine_pairing: This crisp white wine pairs well with a variety of light dishes such as grilled fish, seafood, and salads. It also goes well with simple dishes like roasted chicken or turkey. For a more flavorful pairing, try it with an herbed risotto or a creamy goat cheese tart. If you prefer something sweeter, try it with crème brûlée or poached pears in honey.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine from Tzora Vineyards is truly a special experience! From its origins in the Judean Hills to its crisp and complex flavor, this Blanc is sure to please. Its unique blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, and Viognier offers an explosion of flavor that will tantalize your taste buds. The combination of mineral-rich soil and Mediterranean climate contribute to the complexity of this dry white wine's aromas and flavors. With notes of fruit, nuts, and flowers, it's no wonder why this vintage has become so popular! Enjoy it with friends or family for a truly unforgettable experience.

contexts.wine_description: This exquisite Rivers-Marie Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir from the renowned Sonoma Coast is a unique expression of this classic varietal. Its delicate aromas of red fruit and spice give way to a palate of vibrant cherry, raspberry and earthy notes, complemented by an elegant structure and subtle tannins. An unforgettable experience awaits with every sip.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: At Rivers-Marie Silver Eagle Vineyard, the resident winemaker believes that the best way to make Pinot Noir is with laughter. They use unique techniques such as laughter yoga and singing while they harvest to ensure a truly joyful atmosphere in their vineyards.
contexts.wine_history:
The Rivers-Marie Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir from Sonoma Coast was first planted in the early 1990s by winemaker Thomas Rivers Brown. The vineyard is located on a steep, rocky hillside in the Petaluma Gap AVA, and is known for producing wines with intense aromatics and bright acidity. 

Notable vintage years include 2011, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017. In 2011, the wine won a Gold Medal at the San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition. In 2013, it was awarded 93 points by Robert Parker's Wine Advocate. In 2014, it was named one of Wine & Spirits Magazine's Top 100 Wines of the Year. In 2015, it was awarded 95 points by Jeb Dunnuck of The Rhone Report. In 2016 and 2017, it earned 94 points from both Robert Parker's Wine Advocate and Jeb Dunnuck of The Rhone Report.
contexts.wine_name: Rivers-Marie Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir
contexts.wine_pairing: This Pinot Noir pairs well with a variety of dishes, from lighter fare such as roasted chicken and grilled salmon to heavier dishes like pork tenderloin or beef stew. It is also an excellent accompaniment to earthy mushrooms, garlic-infused vegetables, and creamy pastas. Additionally, the wine's bright acidity makes it a great match for salads and other fresh produce.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Rivers-Marie Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir from Sonoma Coast is a must-try for any wine lover! It's a stunningly beautiful garnet color that entices you to take a sip. As soon as you do, the bouquet of ripe red fruit and fresh herbs tantalizes your nose, while the smooth tannins and juicy black cherry flavors dance across your palate. It's no wonder why this wine is so popular - it's an absolute pleasure to drink!

contexts.wine_description: Domaine Alain Voge Cornas Les Vieilles Vignes is a unique and exciting Rhone wine that offers a complex, yet balanced flavor profile. This wine is made from old vines, giving it an intense concentration of flavors and aromas that are sure to please. It's full-bodied with notes of dark fruit, smoke, spice, and earthy minerals. Enjoy this special bottle with your favorite meal for a truly memorable experience.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery's founder, Alain Voge, is passionate about making delicious wines and he often jokes that the secret to their success is having extremely old vines! He quips that he believes the vines are around 100 years old, but can never be sure as they seem to have lost count.
contexts.wine_history:
The Domaine Alain Voge Cornas Les Vieilles Vignes is a red wine from the Rhone region of France. It is produced by the family-run estate, Domaine Alain Voge, which has been in operation since the early 1950s. The vineyard is located in the commune of Cornas and consists of old vines that are over 50 years old. 

The first vintage of this wine was released in 1985 and it quickly gained a reputation for its intense aromas and flavors. Since then, it has become one of the most sought-after wines from the Rhone Valley. Notable vintages include 1990, 1995, 1998, 2000, 2005, 2009 and 2010. 

In 2011, Alain Voge passed away and his son Jean-Luc took over the estate. He continues to produce this wine with great success and has achieved numerous awards for his efforts.
contexts.wine_name: Domaine Alain Voge Cornas Les Vieilles Vignes
contexts.wine_pairing: This wine is a full-bodied red with notes of blackberry, plum, and pepper. It pairs well with a variety of dishes, including roast beef, game meats such as venison or rabbit, mushroom-based dishes like risotto or pasta with wild mushrooms, robust stews and braised dishes, hard cheeses such as aged cheddar and Parmesan, and dark chocolate desserts.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Domaine Alain Voge Cornas Les Vieilles Vignes from Rhone is a unique and extraordinary wine that is sure to make an impression on any palate. It's made from 100% Syrah grapes, and its complex aromas of dark fruits, spice, and leather are truly remarkable. The flavors are intense yet balanced, with notes of blackberry, plum, licorice, pepper, and a hint of smoky bacon that lingers on the finish. This full-bodied red has a velvet texture and will develop further complexity with age. Enjoy it now or cellar it for future enjoyment - either way you won't be disappointed!

contexts.wine_description: This exquisite Elvio Cogno Barolo Vigna Elena is a unique and complex wine with intense aromas of ripe red fruit, dried flowers, spices and a hint of tobacco. On the palate, it has an elegant structure and intense flavors of blackberry, raspberry, violet and licorice that linger on the finish. With its robust tannins, this Barolo is sure to impress any connoisseur!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: Elvio Cogno is unique in that it produces Barolo wines from several different parcels of land, including Vigna Elena. In addition to its distinctive winemaking practices, the winery also has an unusual mascot - a sheep named Giulia!
contexts.wine_history:
The Elvio Cogno Barolo Vigna Elena is a single-vineyard Barolo from the DOCG region in Piedmont, Italy. It was first produced by the Cogno family in the late 19th century and has been made ever since. The vineyard is located on a south-facing slope at an altitude of 350 meters and consists of calcareous clay soils. The vines are trained using the traditional Guyot system and are planted with Nebbiolo grapes, which are harvested by hand in October.

Notable vintage years for this wine include 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017. In 2010, Elvio Cogno Barolo Vigna Elena was awarded Tre Bicchieri (Three Glasses) from Gambero Rosso for its outstanding quality. In 2014 it was awarded a score of 95/100 from Wine Enthusiast Magazine and in 2017 it was awarded 97/100 from Robert Parker's Wine Advocate. 

In 2018 Elvio Cogno Barolo Vigna Elena was recognized as one of the best wines in Italy by Luca Maroni's Annual Italian Wine Guide with a score of 98/100. This recognition further solidified its status as one of the top wines from Piedmont and Italy as a whole.
contexts.wine_pairing: Elvio Cogno Barolo Vigna Elena is an intense and complex red wine with aromas of dark fruits, spices, and leather. It pairs best with rich dishes such as grilled meats, game, aged cheeses, mushrooms, truffles and roasted vegetables. Its bold flavor profile also pairs well with tomato-based pasta dishes, risotto and polenta. For a truly memorable pairing experience, serve it alongside hearty stews or game birds like pheasant or quail.
contexts.wine_popularity: This Barolo from Elvio Cogno is a true gem! It's a deep, ruby red color that hints at the complexity of its flavor. The aroma is intense and full of rich red fruits, with notes of cherry and raspberry, as well as spices like clove and cinnamon. On the palate, it has a full body with soft tannins that give it an elegant structure. Its finish is long and persistent, with hints of tobacco and leather. This wine is so popular because it perfectly balances richness with finesse - a truly memorable experience!

contexts.wine_description: Domaine Laroche Les Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes is a unique and exciting white wine that offers an intense, complex flavor profile. This full-bodied Chardonnay is crafted from hand-picked grapes grown in old vines, creating a deep and rich character with notes of citrus, apple, and mineral. Enjoy this unique expression of the terroir of Chablis Premier Cru!
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The Domaine Laroche winery is situated in a unique location in the heart of the Chablis wine region, just steps away from the banks of the Serein river. Every day, the owners enjoy watching the river as it meanders past their vineyards and winery. They even have a custom-built swing overlooking the river that they call their "Vintage Swing". So when you're enjoying a bottle of Domaine Laroche Les Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes from Chablis Premier Cru, don't forget to take a moment to appreciate the view!
contexts.wine_history:
The Domaine Laroche Les Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes from Chablis Premier Cru is a white wine produced by the Laroche family in the Burgundy region of France. The family has been producing wines since 1850 and has been making this particular wine since the late 19th century. The vineyard is located on the slopes of the Fourchaume hill, which gives it its name.

The wine is made from 100% Chardonnay grapes grown in limestone-rich soils, giving it a unique minerality and complexity. It is aged for 12 months in oak barrels before being bottled. 

Notable vintage years include 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013. In 2009, the wine was awarded a Gold Medal at the International Wine Challenge and was also named one of Decanter Magazine's Top 10 White Wines of the Year. In 2010, it was awarded a Silver Medal at the International Wine Challenge and was also named one of Decanter Magazine's Top 10 White Wines of the Year. In 2011, it won a Bronze Medal at the International Wine Challenge and was also named one of Decanter Magazine's Top 10 White Wines of the Year. 

In 2012, Domaine Laroche Les Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes from Chablis Premier Cru was awarded a Gold Medal at both The International Wine & Spirit Competition (IWSC) and The Decanter World Wine Awards (DWWA). This year marked an important milestone for Domaine Laroche as they celebrated their 160th anniversary with this award-winning vintage.
contexts.wine_name: Domaine Laroche Les Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes
contexts.wine_pairing: This Chablis Premier Cru is a dry white wine with notes of citrus, mineral, and green apple. It pairs well with seafood dishes such as grilled salmon or sole meuniere, as well as lighter poultry dishes like roast chicken and turkey. Its crisp acidity also makes it a great match for creamy cheeses like brie and camembert. For vegetarians, it goes nicely with goat cheese tartlets or roasted vegetables.
contexts.wine_popularity: This wine is a treat for the senses! On the nose, its aromas of ripe fruit, white flowers, and soft spices tantalize with every sip. On the palate, it's a perfect balance of minerality and acidity that creates an unforgettable experience. With its full-bodied flavor and long finish, it's no wonder why Domaine Laroche Les Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes from Chablis Premier Cru has become so popular!

contexts.wine_description: Ferren Chardonnay is a unique and exciting wine that offers an unforgettable experience. This full-bodied, golden-hued white is brimming with ripe yellow apple, citrus zest, and toasted almond aromas. Its creamy texture and bright acidity make it a perfect pairing for seafood or poultry dishes. With its luscious flavors of tropical fruit and subtle oak nuances, this Chardonnay is sure to please any palate.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: The winery offers visitors a unique experience - you can take a tour of the vineyard and taste the wines, then finish off your visit with a game of bocce ball in the nearby olive grove!
contexts.wine_history:
Ferren Chardonnay is a single-vineyard wine from the Sonoma Coast. It was first produced in 2008, and has since become one of the most sought-after Chardonnays in California. The grapes for this wine are sourced from a small, family-owned vineyard located on the western side of the Sonoma Coast AVA. The vineyard is planted with two clones of Chardonnay, Clone 4 and Clone 95, which are known for their intense aromatics and bright acidity. 

The 2008 vintage was particularly noteworthy for its intense aromas of citrus and tropical fruits, as well as its crisp acidity and long finish. This vintage earned 90 points from Wine Spectator magazine, making it one of the highest rated wines from the region that year. 

Since then, Ferren Chardonnay has consistently been praised by critics and consumers alike for its complexity and balance. The 2013 vintage was especially notable for its rich texture and creamy mouthfeel, while the 2017 vintage earned 92 points from Wine Enthusiast magazine for its ripe fruit flavors and mineral notes.

The Antoine Graillot & Raul Perez 'Encinas' Mencia from Bierzo is a unique and special wine that has been crafted with the utmost care and attention to detail. The grapes used in this wine come from a single vineyard located in the village of Encinas, which is situated in the Bierzo region of Spain. The Mencia grape variety was first planted here in the late 19th century and has since become an integral part of this unique terroir. The combination of old vines, low yields, and careful winemaking techniques have resulted in a truly exceptional wine.

DVO from Napa Valley was founded in 2002 by winemaker David Vella. The winery is located in the heart of the Napa Valley, and specializes in producing small-lot, handcrafted wines from some of the most sought-after vineyards in the region.
